section.title: Adapter Projects

important.para: The steps described in this section requires that you have already created an Identity Manager Application.

section.para: If you have such an application select it in the Application Navigator

section.title: Create a Project
section.para: To start the Create Identity Manager Project Wizard walkthrough:

listitem.para: Open Oracle JDeveloper 12c if it is not already open.
Navigate to the menu File | New | From Gallery... or the correspondending toolbar action.
This invokes the New Gallery dialog to create objects of any sort, from applications or classes to JSPs and UML diagrams, and to set up and maintain your connections.
It can happen that the New Gallery dialog opens with the tab Current Project Technologies selected. In this case, you have to select the tab All Technologies at first.

In the Categories pane on the left scroll down to Identity and Access Management and expand this node. Under this node select the category Identity Manager. This displays the possible wizards you can start from here. Select the item Identity Manager Adapter.
Double click on the item or click OK.

note.para: If a certain gallery item that belongs to a certain feature is not shown either the feature itself is disabled (see Configuring the Features) or the feature is not loaded or configured (see Configuring Identity Manager Preferences).
Walkthrough the appropriate steps to change the configuration.

listitem.para: This close the New Gallery dialog and starts the appropriate wizard that guides you through the required steps. The Wizard is performs several steps that are needed to create most of the configurations. After the wizard Identity Manager Adapter started, complete the steps below to create the project.

section.para: After the wizard Identity Manager Adapter is started complete the following steps to configure the project:

section.title: Name your Project
section.para: On the step Name your Project you have to provide data for:

formalpara.para: A name for the project control file within the file system.
The path to a directory in the application workspace file system structure.

section.title: Project Name
section.para: Per default, an application name in the form ProjectN is shown, where N is a number that increases sequentially from 1.
This is the filename that will be used for the application control file within the file system. The extension .jpr is assumed, but not displayed.
Change this name to an appropriate name related to the customer environment.

important.para: As you type the new name for the project to create you'll recognize that the field Directory is changed accordingly.

section.para: This we will revert to be aligned with the recommended Workspace Structure as explained below.

section.title: Directory
section.para: Enter a directory for the project or click Browse... to locate one. It is easier to use the Browse... button to create the correct file system structure.
The dialog Choose Directory appears.

Per default, the directory of the workspace you are creating the project within is already selected. Click on the Create Directory symbol in the upper right corner of the dialog. A Create New Directory dialog box pops up.
Enter acmeAdapter in the field Directory Name.
Click OK to create the directory and close the popup. You'll be back on Choose Directory dialog box the newly created directory is selected.
Click Select to close the dialog and transfer the selection to the Create Identity Manager Adapter wizard. At the end your screen should looks like:
Click Next.

section.title: Configure Identity Deployment settings
section.para: This page has already populated the default values for a single deployment project. To complete this page you have to specify the Deployment Target location.
In Folder of section Deployment Target you have to enter the location of your deployment in your local file system. The path can be either an existing one or you are creating a new one.

note.para: Accordingly to the Best Practice you created already a deployment project where you have created such a location. The artifacts maintained by a adapter project should target the same location as the deployment project and keep them in sync.

section.para: To pick the deployment path click on symbol near to the Folder field. The Choose Directory dialog appears again. Per default, the directory of the workspace you created in Name your Application is selected, if not select the appropriate folder.
Expand the directory deployment and select oim.
Click Select to close the dialog and transfer the selection to the Create Identity Manager Adapter wizard.
After you completed the section Deployment Target review the further information provided on the page.

entry.literal: Exports the project artifacts from the target host and Identity Manager Instance
Deploys and configures the project artifacts on the target host and the Identity Manager Instance
Deploys and configures the project artifacts on the target host and the Identity Manager Instance

note.para: Not all available properties are initially visible in the wizard page.
To become them visible increase the size of the dialog.

section.para: Click Next.

section.title: Configure Identity Adapter settings
section.para: This page has already populated the default values for a single adapter project.
To complete this page you have to specify:

row.entry: The name of the ANT-build file.
A meaningful description for documentation purpose the ANT-Project is used.
The location pointing to the file system where the build artifacts are copied to.
The name of the adapter packaged library.

entry.literal: The packages to include in the adapter library.

row.entry: The name of the scheduler packaged library.

entry.literal: The packages to include in the scheduler library.
The packages to include in the shared library.

section.title: Deployment Destination Libraries
section.para: Enter a directory for the library or click Browse... symbol to locate one. It is easier to use the Browse... symbol button to create the correct file system structure.
The dialog Choose Directory appears again. As the default the directory of the workspace you are creating the project within is already selected. If not select the appropriate folder.
Expand the directory deployment and select the entry oim.
Now click on symbol in the upper right corner of the dialog to open the Create New Directory dialog.
Enter 0102 systemIntegration in the field Directory Name.
Click OK to close the popup. Again back on the Choose Director dialog box the newly created directory is selected.
Click Select to close the dialog and transfer the selection to the Create Identity Manager Adapter wizard.

section.title: Adapter Java Archive
section.para: This field specified the name of the Java Archive to build belonging to adapters.
Enter acme-adapter for this purpose.

note.para: You not need to put a file extension jar at the name of the java archive.
The build framework underneath is aware of how to handle this.

section.title: Adapter Package Path
section.para: The package path is prepopulated based on the preferences of the workspace.
If this path is sufficient for the purpose of the project, you need not to change it; otherwise apply the package path of your need.

section.title: Scheduler Java Archive
section.para: This field specified the name of the Java Archive to build belonging to scheduled tasks.
Enter acme-scheduler for this purpose.

note.para: You not need to put a file extension jar at the name of the java archive.
The build framework underneath is aware of how to handle this.

section.title: Scheduler Package Path
section.para: The package path is prepopulated based on the preferences of the workspace.
If this path is sufficient for the purpose of the project, you need not to change it; otherwise apply the package path of your need.

section.title: Common Java Archive
section.para: This field specified the name of the Java Archive to build which are shared between adapters and scheduled task.
Enter acme-common for this purpose.

note.para: You not need to put a file extension jar at the name of the java archive.
The build framework underneath is aware of how to handle this.

section.title: Create the Configuration
section.para: After you completed the sections Name your Project, Configure Identity Deployment settings and Configure Identity Adapter settings you ready to create the project. At the end your screen should looks like:
Click Finish to create the project and all artifacts necessary to use it.
This starts the process to create the recommended workspace structure. At the end, the newly created JDeveloper project appears in the Application Navigator.

section.title: Review the Configuration
section.para: After the project was created by the wizard, review the configuration.

section.title: Project Properties
section.para: The wizard has configured the Ant Class path. You can review the changes by navigating to Application | Project Properties... in the main menu or in the context menu of the newly created project.

In the tree of the project properties select the node Ant and expand it to make the node Classpath visible. Select this node and you should see the configuration of the Ant class path like the picture bellow.
Click OK to close the Project Properties dialog.

section.title: Project Structure
section.para: Verify the creation of all files needed by the project by expanding the project node in the Application Navigator.
The configuration process created in the JDeveloper project several content sets.

note.para: Not all content sets are displayed after the JDeveloper project is initially configured due to those content sets are empty at the beginning and filtered out by JDeveloper as long as they are empty.

section.para: One of the content sets is Ant Build Sources.
This content set contains following files:

row.entry: The ANT project build script to compile and package the project artifacts configured in Configure Identity Adapter settings.
The ANT build script to export metadata definitions from Oracle Identity Manager and save them in the directory configured in Configure Identity Deployment settings.
The ANT build script to import metadata definitions into Oracle Identity Manager from the files in the directory configured in Configure Identity Deployment settings.
The ANT build script to import access request catalog definitions and sandboxes into Oracle Identity Manager from the files in the directory configured in Configure Identity Deployment settings.

section.title: Directory Structure
section.para: You should find in your local file system following directory structure:

section.title: Sanity Check
section.para: A quick sanity check should be performed on the newly created project.

section.title: Validate Build Script Export
section.para: Validate the Ant Build Script oim-export-ant.xml by selecting the document node in the content set Ant Build Script displayed in the Application Navigator.
In the oim-export-ant.xml - Structure view below the Application Navigator make a right-mouse-click on the node all to open the context menu.
Click on the menu entry Run Target "all".
In the Apache Ant - Log view you should recognize a successful completion of the task.

section.title: Validate Build Script Import
section.para: Validate the Ant Build Script oim-import-ant.xml by selecting the document node in the content set Ant Build Script displayed in the Application Navigator.
In the oim-import-ant.xml - Structure view below the Application Navigator make a right-mouse-click on the node all to open the context menu.
Click on the menu entry Run Target "all".
In the Apache Ant - Log view you should recognize a successful completion of the task.

section.title: Validate Build Script Request
section.para: Validate the Ant Build Script oim-request-ant.xml by selecting the document node in the content set Ant Build Script displayed in the Application Navigator.
In the oim-request-ant.xml - Structure view below the Application Navigator make a right-mouse-click on the node all to open the context menu.
Click on the menu entry Run Target "all".
In the Apache Ant - Log view you should recognize a successful completion of the task.

section.title: Validate Build Script Export
section.para: Validate the Ant Build Script oim-adapter-ant.xml by selecting the document node in the content set Ant Build Script displayed in the Application Navigator.
On oim-adapter-ant.xml open the context menu by a right mouse click and select Run Ant Target | clean.
In the Apache Ant - Log view you should recognize a successful completion of the task.

section.title: Troubleshooting
section.para: If you cannot perform successful the sanity checks described above you are facing all most a classpath problem. The classpath that the extension is setting up during the project creation assumes that you have completed Configure Versioning and checked out the workspace to a location in your local file system. Furthermore it's also assumed that the preferences for Identity and Access Management and Identity Manager are configured correctly.

If you received only a copy of the JAR's hst-foundation.jar, hst-deployment.jar and oim-deployment.jar they may reside on a different location as the extension assumes. To correct that verify the classpath setup in the Project Properties

listitem.para: Select the project in the Application Navigator and use a right-mouse-click to open the Project Context Menu.
In the navigation tree expand the Ant node and select Classpath in the tree. This displays the Ant: Classpath panel. The created classpath will look like depict below:
As the last three entries you'll find the JAR's where the issue can be related to.
Use the button Edit Entry... to adjust the JAR's to your location. Click OK to close to dialog to apply the changes to the project configuration.
Repeat the sanity checks on the project.

note.para:
If you still have trouble to complete the sanity checks successful contact one of the contacts listed on the
Wiki Home Page
